clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Indicated as a diagnostic agent in routine ocular examinations or when superficial conjunctiva or corneal tissue change is suspected and as an aid in the diagnosis of keratoconjunctivitis sicca keratitis abrasions or corrosions as well as the detection of foreign bodies

contraindications.disease: Rose Bengal induces cytotoxic effects in different cell lines A32402
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Rose bengal is a staining agent that visualized ocular surfaces of both diseased and dead cells _in vivo_ A32400 It has also shown to stain healthy cultured cells including rabbit corneal epithelial cells in a rapid dose dependent manner A32401 Various studies demonstrate the cytotoxic effects of rose bengal in different cell cultures including smooth muscle cells from human intestine endothelial cells from bovinepulmonary artery rabbit Tenon fibro blasts and rabbit and human corneal epithelial cells A32400 Cellular morphological changes such as detachment separation loss of motility and disruption in addition to swelling intracytoplasmic vacuole formation and lysis have been manifested with the treatment of rose bengal A32400 indicating that rose Bengal is not a vital dye
